net.labels: Model of how the timings of the system tasks influence scheduling. Each task has three constants, defining its period (amount of time between each release of the task), a best case execution time and a worst case execution time. All three are in tenths of milliseconds. Task priorities are simulated through inhibitor arcs, as higher priority tasks have inhibitor arcs from their ready states, to the ready states of lower priority tasks. Preemption and waiting is not simulated.
Higher priorty tasks, that inhibit starting if they are ready tehmselves.
Time since last release of task
